Sunhawk suspected he would be followed which was why
he started out in another direction and circled
around, but just in case he kept monitoring the
ground.  Shortly before he was going to turn he spoted
a figure.  Probably and animal, but he wasn't sure. 
He went to robot mode and a laser sword poped out of
his wrist compartment.  He dropped straight at
Nightshade.

OOC: I had posted that when he was on the ground and
Nightshade was trying to flank him he planted a
grenade where he was likely to step on it as he moved.

--- Jonathan <jhogan@...> wrote:
> > Sunhawk:  Gotta' get back to Talos....gotta' get
> more
> > troops... gotta' finish the Predicons.
> >
> 
> {Nightshade}
> 
>     A swift and silent shadow darted across the
> landscape mirroring the bird
> bots path, her beast form ran silently as she bound
> behind and to the far
> left of Sunhawk. In the confusion of the general
> melee she had taken the
> opportunity to position herself apart from both
> groups to follow the maximal
> in the inevitable retreat he had to make.
> 
>     Some cards had to be thrown on the table if the
> bot was the example of
> the maximals that were on their trail. Smiling a
> foxy grin she quickened her
> pace to make sure she didn't lose the flyer. She was
> careful to keep her
> signature masked so he couldn't detect her with
> sensors, unless he turned
> and actively searched the ground she doubted he'd
> notice her.
> 
> 
> 
>
